body.p:
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin,
Governor of Kentucky,

Your petitioner Charles Green States that at the Feby term 1861 of the Daviess Circuit Court he was found Guilty of permitting unlawful Gaming in a house in his occupation & fined the Sum of $200. & the costs of the prosecution.

The evidence in the cause was that he had on one occasion only permitted a game of Euchre to be played in his house for beer. He says that th he did not know & had no idea that he was violating any law of the State or he never would have permitted Said game to have been played in his house, wherefore he asks to be released from sd fine.
Charles Green Says upon his oath that the statements of the above petition all true. Given under my hand this 23d. Feby 1861.
Att. Wm B Wall N. P. D. C.

We the undersigned petitioners join in the prayer of the above petition, and state the petitioner Charles Green, is & has always demeaned himself, as a Strictly honest man, that
he is a sober, dicreet, law abiding man, industrious & well behaved in every respect, an excellenct citizen & much esteemed in this Community.

The Court, who pronounced the Judgement, the atty for the Comth, who prosecuted the case, the Jury which rendered the verdict & the members of the bar who heard the cause tried, and all of whom are intimately acquainted with the petitioner respectfully and earnestly pray your Excellency to release the fine.
We further Say that the Statements of the petition are true.

W. H. Talbutt, Jouror
